Life Skill Options:
Writing a thank
you note or drawing a gratitude card
How to Teach / Impart (notes):
1. Show Viraj your own thank-you note.
2. Together choose one person to thank this week.
3. Let him design the card and write the message.
4. Deliver personally or send photo.
Daily Rituals (summary):
Morning: 3-min gratitude sharing.
After school: Game + “one good thing about today.”
Evening: Story about kindness.
Bonding Activity Options: Make a family gratitude jar together.
Park Time Options (10\u201314+):
Name 5 colors you can see around
Walk heel-to-toe along a straight line
Bird watch: name color, size, sound of one bird
Pick 3 tiny litter bits (with care)
Kicking practice to a goal line (10 kicks)
Time check: leave on schedule when called
Make a circle with chalk and do 5 jumps inside
Stone stack: build a 3‑stone tower
Stair count: up/down 10 steps safely, counting aloud
Hydration check: 5 sips of water mid-play
Balance walk on a painted line/curb (hand-in-hand if needed)
Slalom run around 5 cones/stones
Letter hunt: find shapes that look like A, O, T
Throw-and-catch 10 times (soft ball)
Trivia Bank (15+):
01. What number comes just before 13? — 12
02. Which is bigger: 19 or 90? — 90
03. Count back from 20 to 16. What is the last number you say? — 16
04. What number comes after 17? — 18
05. How many fingers are on both your hands? — 10
06. Odd one out: cat, dog, banana — banana
07. Which shape has 4 equal sides? — Square
08. Where does the minute hand point at 12 o’clock? — At 12 (top)
09. Which is heavier: a stone or a feather? — Stone
10. What do magnets stick to: a steel spoon or a paper towel? — Steel spoon
11. If you have 3 apples and eat 1, how many are left? — 2
12. Which has no corners: circle or triangle? — Circle
13. Which day comes after Monday? — Tuesday
14. Which is a living thing: tree or chair? — Tree
15. Clap the syllables in ‘ban-a-na’. How many claps? — 3
16. What number has two tens: 20 or 12? — 20

Life Skill Options: Introducing yourself confidently to someone new
How to Teach / Impart (notes):
1. Role-play introductions at home.
2. Practice at park or shopkeeper.
3. Praise effort, not just outcome.
Daily Rituals (summary):
Morning: “I am brave, I am strong.”
After school: Game + share “one brave thing.”
Evening: Story of a hero.
Bonding Activity Options: Go on a small adventure together (new park, cycling route).
Park Time Options (10\u201314+):
Nature sketch: 3‑minute quick drawing on a pad
Kicking practice to a goal line (10 kicks)
Practice patient queuing for a slide
Ask to join a group game politely
Stair count: up/down 10 steps safely, counting aloud
Sprint to a marker and back (3 rounds)
Leaf/rock collection: find 3 different textures
Say hello to one child and ask to join a turn
Walk heel-to-toe along a straight line
Return a found object to the guard/attendant
Bird watch: name color, size, sound of one bird
Thank the gardener/guard on exit
Time check: leave on schedule when called
Hopscotch: 1–5 hops each
Trivia Bank (15+):
01. Continue the pattern: 2, 4, 6, __ — 8
02. What number comes before 20? — 19
03. How many sides does a triangle have? — 3
04. Which is longer: a train or a car? — Train
05. Odd one out: spoon, fork, tiger — Tiger
06. Which season is the hottest in India? — Summer
07. What time of day do we see stars: day or night? — Night
08. How many legs does a spider have? — 8
09. Which shape can roll easily: cylinder or cube? — Cylinder
10. If you have 5 candies and get 2 more, how many now? — 7
11. Which is a fruit: tomato or potato? — Tomato
12. What comes after 14? — 15
13. Which is bigger: 18 or 81? — 81
14. Which sense do you use to smell flowers? — Smell (nose)
15. What is the first month of the year? — January
16. Which animal gives us wool? — Sheep

How to Teach / Impart (notes):
1. Demonstrate organising your own items.
2. Give Viraj a small area to keep neat.
3. Review together each evening.
Daily Rituals (summary):
Morning: “Today I will take care of…”
After school: Game + share responsibility done.
Evening: Story of responsibility.
Park Time Options (10\u201314+):
Keep track of your water bottle
Jump over 5 small lines/tiles safely
Breathing with trees: inhale under shade, exhale long
Hydration check: 5 sips of water mid-play
Slalom run around 5 cones/stones
Balance a small leaf on your head for 10 steps
Balance walk on a painted line/curb (hand-in-hand if needed)
Bird watch: name color, size, sound of one bird
Shadow tag (no pushing) for 3 minutes
Practice patient queuing for a slide
Thank the gardener/guard on exit
Time check: leave on schedule when called
Stone stack: build a 3‑stone tower
Roll a ball to each other 15 times
Trivia Bank (15+):
01. Count by 2s from 2 to 10. What is the last number? — 10
02. What number comes after 11? — 12
03. How many corners does a rectangle have? — 4
04. Odd one out: circle, square, ball — Ball
05. Which travels faster: bicycle or airplane? — Airplane
06. What do plants need besides water to grow? — Sunlight
07. If it’s raining, what do you use: umbrella or sunglasses? — Umbrella
08. Which animal lays eggs: hen or cow? — Hen
09. Continue the pattern: red, blue, red, blue, __ — Red
10. How many tens are in 30? — 3 tens
11. Which is the smallest: 13, 9, 11? — 9
12. What do you call a baby dog? — Puppy
13. Which direction does the sun rise from? — East
14. Which has seeds inside: apple or carrot? — Apple
15. Which is lighter: balloon or book? — Balloon
16. What shape is a traffic wheel? (trick!) — No wheel; traffic light is circles

Life Skill Options: Speaking the truth even in small matters
How to Teach / Impart (notes):
1. Share a story of when telling truth was hard for you.
2. Praise him when he tells truth, even if inconvenient.
3. Play ‘truth-telling’ game at home.
Daily Rituals (summary):
Morning: “I speak the truth.”
After school: Game + share one honest moment.
Evening: Story about honesty.
Park Time Options (10\u201314+):
Breathing with trees: inhale under shade, exhale long
Walk heel-to-toe along a straight line
Kicking practice to a goal line (10 kicks)
Jump over 5 small lines/tiles safely
Count 10 trees or benches together
Tree pose (yoga) for 10 slow breaths
Balance a small leaf on your head for 10 steps
Shadow tag (no pushing) for 3 minutes
Slalom run around 5 cones/stones
Stair count: up/down 10 steps safely, counting aloud
Bird watch: name color, size, sound of one bird
Offer a toy for sharing (1 minute)
Describe exactly what you see in the park (no exaggeration)
Cloud shapes: spot and describe 3 shapes
Trivia Bank (15+):
01. What day comes before Sunday? — Saturday
02. How many days are in a week? — 7
03. Which clock shows 3 o’clock: the one with the short hand at 3 or at 9? — Short hand at 3
04. If bedtime is at 8:00, is that morning or night? — Night
05. How many months are in a year? — 12
06. Which is more: 16 or 61? — 61
07. What number comes after 19? — 20
08. Odd one out: breakfast, lunch, purple — Purple
09. Which shape has 2 long and 2 short sides usually? — Rectangle
10. How many wheels on a tricycle? — 3
11. What season do we see the most rain in India? — Monsoon
12. What animal is the ‘ship of the desert’? — Camel
13. If you have 10 blocks and give 3 to a friend, how many left? — 7
14. Which is colder: ice or warm water? — Ice
15. What is the opposite of ‘open’? — Closed
16. Which letter does ‘zebra’ start with? — Z

How to Teach / Impart (notes):
1. Choose a simple help task daily.
2. Do it together once, then let him do it alone.
3. Acknowledge every act of kindness.
Daily Rituals (summary):
Morning: “I will look for ways to help.”
After school: Game + share kindness done.
Evening: Story of kindness.
Bonding Activity Options: Make and deliver a small snack for neighbour or friend.
Park Time Options (10\u201314+):
Bird watch: name color, size, sound of one bird
Balance a small leaf on your head for 10 steps
Roll a ball to each other 15 times
Follow-the-leader movement patterns (walk, tiptoe, stomp)
Throw-and-catch 10 times (soft ball)
Practice patient queuing for a slide
Offer a toy for sharing (1 minute)
Name 5 colors you can see around
Help a younger child climb safely
Thank the gardener/guard on exit
Kicking practice to a goal line (10 kicks)
Balance beam using a low bench/line (with support)
Leaf/rock collection: find 3 different textures
Return a found object to the guard/attendant
Trivia Bank (15+):
01. Capital of India? — New Delhi
02. National animal of India? — Bengal Tiger
03. National bird of India? — Indian Peacock
04. National flag has how many colors? — 3 (saffron, white, green)
05. Which festival is the festival of colors? — Holi
06. Which festival is the festival of lights? — Diwali
07. Currency of India? — Rupee
08. Which monument is in Agra and is white marble? — Taj Mahal
09. Which is bigger: 25 or 52? — 52
10. Odd one out: rupee, dollar, mango — Mango
11. How many states are there in India? (as of now) — 28
12. Which ocean is to the south of India? — Indian Ocean
13. What do we call India’s national game traditionally? — Hockey (traditional)
14. What is the national flower of India? — Lotus
15. Which animal is known as the king of the jungle? — Lion
16. What number comes before 15? — 14

How to Teach / Impart (notes):
1. Play games that require turns.
2. Use a timer for small waits.
3. Praise when he waits calmly.
Daily Rituals (summary):
Morning: “I can wait calmly.”
After school: Game that needs turn-taking.
Evening: Story about patience.
Bonding Activity Options: Plant a small seed and care for it together.
Park Time Options (10\u201314+):
Time check: leave on schedule when called
Breathing with trees: inhale under shade, exhale long
Slalom run around 5 cones/stones
Follow-the-leader movement patterns (walk, tiptoe, stomp)
Walk heel-to-toe along a straight line
Throw-and-catch 10 times (soft ball)
Nature sketch: 3‑minute quick drawing on a pad
Leaf/rock collection: find 3 different textures
Letter hunt: find shapes that look like A, O, T
Cloud shapes: spot and describe 3 shapes
Shadow tag (no pushing) for 3 minutes
Jump over 5 small lines/tiles safely
Offer a toy for sharing (1 minute)
Bird watch: name color, size, sound of one bird
Trivia Bank (15+):
01. Which animal is a mammal: whale or shark? — Whale
02. Which bird cannot fly: ostrich or eagle? — Ostrich
03. How many legs does an insect have? — 6
04. Which animal lives both in water and on land: frog or cat? — Frog
05. Odd one out: carrot, potato, apple — Apple
06. Which part of the plant is usually underground? — Roots
07. If you plant a seed, what grows: a rock or a plant? — Plant
08. Which is a reptile: snake or cow? — Snake
09. Continue the pattern: 5, 10, 15, __ — 20
10. Which number is the smallest: 7, 17, 27? — 7
11. How many sides does a hexagon have? — 6
12. Which sense helps you hear music? — Hearing (ears)
13. Which is heavier: a bucket of water or a cup of water? — Bucket of water
14. What do bees make from nectar? — Honey
15. Which animal gives us milk: cow or crow? — Cow
16. What comes after 12? — 13

Life Skill Options: Doing what needs to be done without being told
How to Teach / Impart (notes):
1. Make a simple checklist for him.
2. Let him tick tasks without reminders.
3. Celebrate completion.
Daily Rituals (summary):
Morning: “I will finish what I start.”
After school: Game + discuss task done.
Evening: Story on discipline.
Park Time Options (10\u201314+):
Kicking practice to a goal line (10 kicks)
Tree pose (yoga) for 10 slow breaths
Stone stack: build a 3‑stone tower
Make a circle with chalk and do 5 jumps inside
Long jump marks: jump from line and measure with feet
Throw-and-catch 10 times (soft ball)
Follow-the-leader movement patterns (walk, tiptoe, stomp)
Say hello to one child and ask to join a turn
Roll a ball to each other 15 times
Stair count: up/down 10 steps safely, counting aloud
Letter hunt: find shapes that look like A, O, T
Leaf/rock collection: find 3 different textures
Jump over 5 small lines/tiles safely
Cloud shapes: spot and describe 3 shapes
Trivia Bank (15+):
01. Find the odd one: Monday, Tuesday, Pizza — Pizza
02. Continue: 1, 3, 5, __ — 7
03. Which is a triangle? (3, 4, or 5 sides?) — 3 sides
04. What number comes before 18? — 17
05. Which shows daytime: sun or moon? — Sun
06. What do you use to measure time: clock or ruler? — Clock
07. How many corners does a star (typical) have? — 5 points
08. What shape are most wheels? — Circle
09. Opposite of ‘fast’? — Slow
10. If you have 8 marbles and lose 2, how many left? — 6
11. Which animal can climb trees and likes bananas? — Monkey
12. Which is a vehicle: bus or house? — Bus
13. Which is more: 9+1 or 7+2? — 9+1 (10)
14. What comes after 10 when skip-counting by 5s? — 15
15. Odd one out: square, cube, rectangle — Cube (3D)
16. Which direction is opposite of up? — Down

How to Teach / Impart (notes):
1. Model respectful listening.
2. Set a ‘no interrupting’ challenge.
3. Thank him for listening.
Daily Rituals (summary):
Morning: “I will listen with respect.”
After school: Game that needs listening.
Evening: Story on respect.
Bonding Activity Options: Visit an elder relative/friend and listen to their story.

Cloud shapes: spot and describe 3 shapes
Hydration check: 5 sips of water mid-play
Letter hunt: find shapes that look like A, O, T

Tree pose (yoga) for 10 slow breaths

Practice patient queuing for a slide
Hopscotch: 1–5 hops each
Leaf/rock collection: find 3 different textures

Roll a ball to each other 15 times
Breathing with trees: inhale under shade, exhale long

Follow-the-leader movement patterns (walk, tiptoe, stomp)

01. How many 5-rupee coins make 20 rupees? — 4

06. Which is longer: pencil or eraser? — Pencil (usually)
07. Continue: 2, 5, 8, __ — 11

14. If you have 10 stickers and give 4 away, how many left? — 6
15. Which shape has no straight sides? — Circle
16. How many days are in February (non-leap year)? — 28

1. Play cooperative games.
2. Involve him in small household project.
3. Praise team effort.
Daily Rituals (summary):
Morning: “Together we can.”
After school: Team game.
Evening: Story on teamwork.
Bonding Activity Options: Build or cook something as a family.

How to Teach / Impart (notes):
1. Choose one toy/book to give away.
2. Explain why sharing matters.
3. Make it celebratory, not forced.
Daily Rituals (summary):
Morning: “I am happy to share.”
After school: Share snack or toy.
Evening: Story on generosity.
Bonding Activity Options: Visit a place where you can donate together.
Park Time Options (10\u201314+):
Thank the gardener/guard on exit
Leaf/rock collection: find 3 different textures
Offer a toy for sharing (1 minute)
Balance a small leaf on your head for 10 steps
Cloud shapes: spot and describe 3 shapes
Practice patient queuing for a slide
Throw-and-catch 10 times (soft ball)
Roll a ball to each other 15 times
Stair count: up/down 10 steps safely, counting aloud
Return a found object to the guard/attendant
Hopscotch: 1–5 hops each
Count 10 trees or benches together
Nature sketch: 3‑minute quick drawing on a pad
Balance beam using a low bench/line (with support)
Trivia Bank (15+):
01. Riddle: I have hands but cannot clap. What am I? — A clock
02. Riddle: I’m full of holes but hold water. What am I? — A sponge
03. Riddle: I go up when rain comes down. What am I? — An umbrella
04. Riddle: I have a face and two hands but no legs. What am I? — A clock
05. Riddle: What has a tail and four legs but is not alive? (toy) — A toy animal (e.g., toy dog)
06. Riddle: What can you catch but not throw? — A cold
07. Riddle: What gets wet while drying you? — A towel
08. Logic: Which is more: 8 or 3+6? — 3+6 (9)
09. Math: If you count by 10s from 10, what comes after 30? — 40
10. Shape: How many sides in an octagon? — 8
11. Time: What day comes after Friday? — Saturday
12. Science: Which one melts: ice or rock? — Ice
13. Nature: Which grows from an acorn? — Oak tree
14. Language: Which word rhymes with ‘star’: car or bed? — Car
15. GK: Which planet do we live on? — Earth
16. GK: Which animal lives in a hive? — Bee
